intro: Sida biserrata, commonly known as the rough sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions. Sida biserrata is known for its adaptability and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
